meanings.definition: To contract with another party to perform a specific task or job.
meanings.sent1: The construction company is subcontracting the electrical work to a local electrician.
meanings.sent2: Our company decided to subcontract the IT support services to a specialized firm.
meanings.sent3: The chef subcontracted the dessert preparation to his talented pastry chef.
meanings.sent4: She subcontracted the event planning to her organized friend.
meanings.sent5: Subcontracting the cleaning duties allowed the team to focus on their main tasks.

meanings.definition: The practice of hiring another company or individual to complete work on behalf of the original contractor.
meanings.sent1: Subcontracting has become a common practice in the construction industry.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was partly due to their efficient subcontracting strategies.
meanings.sent3: The subcontracting of the project saved time and resources for the main contractor.
meanings.sent4: She admired the subcontracting skills of the project manager.
meanings.sent5: The subcontracting process streamlined the workflow and improved efficiency.
